title: Jamie Redknapp sends message to Arsenal and Chelsea fans over Nicolas Pepe and Christian Pulisic
text:
Arsenal record signing Nicolas Pepe and Chelsea star Christian Pulisic (Pictures: Getty)

Jamie Redknapp has backed Nicolas Pepe and Christian Pulisic to develop into Premier League stars and urged Arsenal and Chelsea fans to be patient with the summer additions.

Both Pepe and Pulisic arrived in the Premier League over the summer, with Arsenal spending a club-record £72m to sign Ivory Coast international Pepe from Lille.

Chelsea agreed a £58m deal for Pulisic in January 2018 but the USA star was immediately loaned back to Borussia Dortmund before making the switch to Stamford Bridge in the summer.

Sky Sports pundit and former Premier League star Jamie Redknapp (Picture: Getty)

Pepe and Pulisic endured slow starts to their Premier League careers but are beginning to show their ability at the London clubs.

Ex-Lille man Pepe scored a brace in Arsenal’s comeback Europa League win over Vitoria Guimarae while Pulisic bagged his first Chelsea hat-trick against Burnley on Saturday.

‘Frank Lampard knows what he is doing with Pulisic,’ former Premier League star Redknapp told the Daily Mail. ‘He is taking care of the 21-year-old forward.

‘The American is obviously keen to impress – he cut short his summer holidays so he could get to Chelsea and impress his new boss as soon as possible – but there is no rush.

‘The same goes for Nicolas Pepe at Arsenal. Yes the Frenchman cost a club record £72m but can we not give him time before branding him a flop or bad buy?

‘To write the 24-year-old off after a few months is ludicrous and downright unfair. I believe Pepe will come good, and I think Pulisic will, too.

‘You learn a lot about a player’s personality when you speak to him after a match.

‘Before meeting Pulisic for the first time on Saturday, after he agreed to join us for a pitchside chat on Sky, I wasn’t sure what to expect.

Advertisement

‘I knew how huge he was in America, so would he be confident? Arrogant? Yet after speaking to him, I left with the impression that this is a nice, mild-mannered boy.

‘He was quiet, shy almost. He even had to be told by his team-mates to collect the match ball, because it was his first-ever professional hat-trick!

‘Let’s give Pulisic the time he deserves and see how far he can go.’

Arsenal face Premier League leaders Liverpool in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup on Wednesday, while Chelsea host Manchester United on the same evening.
